thread.title: Corruption Currents: U.S. Special Counsel’s Probe Marks First Year - Risk & Compliance Journal. - WSJ

author: Samuel Rubenfeld
title: Corruption Currents: U.S. Special Counsel’s Probe Marks First Year - Risk & Compliance Journal. - WSJ
text:
0 COMMENTS U.S. special counsel Robert Mueller testifies on Capitol Hill on June 13, 2013, when he was serving as the FBI director. Photo: Reuters
A daily roundup of corruption news from across the Web. We also provide a daily roundup of important risk & compliance stories via our daily newsletter, The Morning Risk Report, which readers can sign up for here . Follow us on Twitter at @WSJRisk.
Bribery:
Former Italian president Silvio Berlusconi was indicted on bribery charges; the story didn’t contain a response. (Ansa)
Bribery is rampant in Namibia’s private sector. (Namibian)
Local cases: Is 54 months in prison enough of a deterrent to stop politicians from taking bribes? Jury deliberations are under way in a Long Island corruption trial . Star witnesses will take the stand in an Arizona corruption trial. (WP, News12, AP, NYT, AZF)
Cybercrime:
A suspect was charged in the leak of the CIA’s hacking tools, but he had allegedly previously posted them online . (NYT, DB)
The FBI made an arrest that appears to have cracked a cybercrime extortion group. (McClatchy)
Hackers breached the company that helps police track cell phones across the U.S. (Motherboard)
Two members of a London-based cybercrime group were jailed . (SKY)
A cybersecurity think tank has some questionable tactics and credentials. (BF)
Money Laundering:
Access to suspicious-activity reports relating to transactions made by Michael Cohen, U.S. President Donald Trump’s personal attorney, was restricted . Earlier reports suggested they had gone missing following the leak of their details. Mr. Cohen’s business dealings are the subject of a criminal investigation . (Slate, Vox, BF, HP, NYer, WP, Yahoo, BF, WP, WP, Intercept, WP, McClatchy, WP)
Swiss authorities conducted several searches of alleged money laundering linked to the Angolan sovereign wealth fund. (SI)
Hong Kong is raising its efforts against money laundering. (CNBC)
Latvia’s anti-money laundering chief wants more help from banks and a bigger staff . (Reuters, BNE, LSM)
Nigerian authorities say a witness’ statements in a money-laundering case were made freely. (Channels)
A lawyer allegedly helped the daughters of Azerbaijan’s president launder money ; he couldn’t be reached. (Guardian, Times)
Sanctions:
The European Commission is proposing EU governments make direct money transfers to Iran’s central bank to avoid U.S. penalties. Would blocking regulations be of little use ? France’s president said European companies will fend for themselves. (Reuters, release, NI, FT, Reuters, Economist, Reuters, Reuters)
Sanctions on Iran and Venezuela may end up helping U.S. rivals . (NYT)
The Russian effort to undermine Magnitsky Act sanctions continued through the presidential transition. A public backlash led Russia to pause an effort to criminalize compliance with U.S. sanctions. (DB, Meduzia, Reuters, RFE/RL)
A Korean utility firm’s business in Iran could be hit by the renewed U.S. sanctions on Iran. (Yonhap)
Actor Sean Penn won’t testify at accused drug kingpin Joaquin “El Chapo” Guzman’s trial. (NYDN)
A small Russian bank is helping Venezula with its sanctions-evading cryptocurrency efforts. (AP)
The U.S. left U.N. sanctions relief for Iran in place when walking away from the nuclear deal. (Brookings, CSM)
Digital money laundering is a growing problem . (Guardian)
A House panel backed the penalties on ZTE Corp. (Politico)
Whistleblowers:
Lawyers for Royal Bank of Scotland PLC asked a former employee to destroy documents, according to a whistleblower’s letter. (Reuters)
General Anti-Corruption:
The U.S. special counsel’s probe crossed the one - year mark and it shows no sign of stopping . In a court filing Mr. Mueller laid out the scope of the investigation ; the probe’s origins go back to mid-2016. One of the companies charged has challenged the prosecutor, saying he’s been slow to hand over evidence. The special counsel secured another guilty plea. The president prepares for an interview . (NY, CNN, NPR, WP, CNBC, Guardian, NJ, McClatchy, WP, MJ, NPR, Bloomberg, Reuters, Politico, Bloomberg, Politico, Wired, NYT, WP, Reuters, Reuters, BF, Politico, ABC)
Refugees in Sudan accused the U.N. of chronic corruption. (IRIN)
Corruption continues unabated in Thailand, angering locals.
Local issues: Maryland’s governor signed a law authorizing an investigation into police corruption in Baltimore. A former U.S. prosecutor backed a plan by actress Cynthia Nixon, who is running for New York governor, to reconstitute an anti-corruption panel. (BS, NYDN)
